sentence3: We were together for several weeks so I can monitor her.
sentence4: Before I was about to leave, she was about to run into a glass window.
sentence5: I immediately ran after her to redirect her.

sentence1: The baseball team had been practicing for their big game for months.
sentence2: The game was almost over, and the bases were loaded.
sentence3: Brian was nervous as he went up to the plate.
sentence4: But he hit the ball on his first try, and it flew into the outfield.
sentence5: Brian made it to the home plate, and the game was won!

sentence1: Chris took his girl on a boat trip.
sentence2: They went to channel islands Park.
sentence3: The ferry ride was an hour.
sentence4: Along the way they saw blue whales.
sentence5: It was the most amazing boat ride.

sentence1: Anna and her friend were playing at the beach.
sentence2: Then Anna had a great idea.
sentence3: She knew pirates buried their pressure on the beach.
sentence4: She and her friend hurriedly began digging for treasure.
sentence5: To their dismay, though, they found none.

sentence1: Jerry was cooking a steak on his cast iron skillet.
sentence2: All of a sudden, his skillet lit on fire.
sentence3: He had set his stove way too high of a temperature.
sentence4: Jerry let the flames die down.
sentence5: He had to turn off the smoke detectors inside his home.

sentence1: Julie's family wanted a new dog.
sentence2: They visited an animal shelter to get one.
sentence3: Julie loved all the dogs, but one cute mutt in particular.
sentence4: They took him home and she named him Jax.
sentence5: Julie was so happy, and loved Jax dearly.

sentence1: Bonnie and Connie were getting tired of wearing matching clothes.
sentence2: They talked their mom into buying clothes of different styles.
sentence3: Connie bought outfits that were pink and frilly.
sentence4: Bonnie bought outfits that were black and revealing.
sentence5: Both girls felt more unique and happier in different outfits.

sentence1: Jerry went to a bar and ordered a few drinks.
sentence2: A guy next to him brushed against Jerry's shoulder.
sentence3: Jerry spilled his drink and demanded that guy buy him another drink.
sentence4: They began fighting and Jerry beat him up.
sentence5: Jerry went to jail but the major problem was the threats he made.

sentence1: Once I met a cute boy.
sentence2: He was an artist.
sentence3: We decided to date and get to know one another.
sentence4: One day, I told him my favorite president was Teddy Roosevelt.
sentence5: He said he didn't care for history and we never spoke again.

sentence1: Evie is a jewel thief.
sentence2: She only steals the finest jewels.
sentence3: A mobster asked Evie to steal a famous painting.
sentence4: The mobster offered Evie a large amount of money.
sentence5: Evie told the mobster no thank you, she only steals jewels.

sentence1: Bill turned 21 last week.
sentence2: He went to his first bar and had his first few drinks.
sentence3: His favorite drink was Gin and Tonic and he drank a lot of it.
sentence4: He got pretty drunk and had a good time.
sentence5: His girlfriend drove him home, thankfully.

sentence1: When my child turned 5 I began to work at her school as a TA.
sentence2: I become so interested in working with the special education students.
sentence3: I became very interested in why some kids have a harder time learning.
sentence4: I went back and got a teaching certification in special education.
sentence5: Now my child has grown up and I still have a job I love.

sentence1: Amy's coach was giving a pep talk before the game.
sentence2: Amy was so excited she barely paid attention.
sentence3: She was in the locker room with all the older girls.
sentence4: She felt like an adult.
sentence5: She wished she could take a picture to remember this moment.

sentence1: Last week I went to our building common room to read.
sentence2: Someone had left a book in the library.
sentence3: The book was written by J K Rowling under a pseudonym.
sentence4: It was a murder mystery.
sentence5: I liked the book so much I bought another one in the series.

sentence1: Tom had anger problems.
sentence2: His parents would try to calm him down.
sentence3: They finally sent him to anger management classes.
sentence4: He hated being there.
sentence5: In time though, he got much better.

sentence1: Ken was sad.
sentence2: He didn't think anyone loved him.
sentence3: He didn't talk to anyone at school.
sentence4: He didn't even talk to his teachers.
sentence5: Ken was reassured by his mother that he would always be loved.

sentence1: David was excited when his parents bought him a chemistry set.
sentence2: He loved doing experiments in the basement.
sentence3: One day, he mixed the wrong chemicals and an explosion broke windows.
sentence4: He was afraid his parents were going to confiscate his new toy.
sentence5: They let him keep it, but insisted on supervising him from then on.

sentence1: Tom liked to sing.
sentence2: Tom was not a good singer.
sentence3: No one liked to be around him because of his singing.
sentence4: Tom married a woman who was deaf and could not hear his singing.
sentence5: His wife and all of her friends found no problem with Tom

sentence1: Courtney loves to play the lottery.
sentence2: She has a special system she uses to pick her numbers.
sentence3: Last night she went to the store and bought five tickets.
sentence4: She checked her tickets this morning and found out she won $5,000.
sentence5: Courtney went to the lottery office to claim her prize.

sentence1: Selena always tried to get a great Christmas photo.
sentence2: Unfortunately her family hated posing for photos.
sentence3: Selena had to resort to bribery to convince them to do it.
sentence4: Eventually she was able to get everyone in one place.
sentence5: The photo was taken and Selena knew her efforts were worth it.

sentence1: I used to love going to the movies.
sentence2: Now I will never go back because it's expensive.
sentence3: They overcharge for everything.
sentence4: Food and the tickets are overpriced.
sentence5: I am much happier with my Netflix subscription instead.

sentence1: I was watching discovery today.

sentence3: There were kangaroos fighting each other.
sentence4: One kangaroo kicked another kangaroo.
sentence5: The other kangaroo died from the wound.

sentence1: Lucy needed a new case.

sentence3: It took weeks to find one.
sentence4: Finally she decided to get a cheap one.
sentence5: She couldn't have been happier.

sentence1: Sarah bought a dozen donuts.
sentence2: She brought them home for her friends.
sentence3: The boys were excited.
sentence4: They each picked out a donut to eat.
sentence5: They thanked Sarah for the food.

sentence1: Sara needed to do her homework.

sentence3: So she took a break.
sentence4: Tom said she was just making excuses.
sentence5: And Sara never made efforts to get help.

sentence1: My friend got a good work contract.
sentence2: He said he's getting about $30,000.
sentence3: So, he took me out for a celebratory drink.

sentence5: Now he's looking forward to an easy season.

sentence1: Jack wants to go out with Jill.
sentence2: But Jill is unsure.
sentence3: He plays a cheesy love song in front of her and the whole school.
sentence4: She agrees to go out with him.
sentence5: They fall in love with each other and live happily ever after.

sentence1: Tee wanted to paint her nails.
sentence2: She borrowed some polish from her mom.
sentence3: Then she applied it carefully.
sentence4: When it dried, she slicked on another coat.
sentence5: Her nails came out beautifully!

sentence1: Todd took his suit into the dry cleaners to get it cleaned.
sentence2: He gave the clerk the suit and asked when to pick it up.
sentence3: The clerk said in three hours.
sentence4: Todd drove home and drove back in three hours.
sentence5: He got the suit, paid, and drove home again.
